dtliExcerpt: Steve Martin's first new play in more than a decade proves to be a slight but likable comedy that gets by on the charm of its four-person cast and the playwright's gift for absurdist dialogue.
bwwExcerpt: No doubt Martin had in mind a cutting commentary on the obstacles faced in keeping a modern marriage together, and the vital importance for a couple of presenting a united front, even against the enemy within. But Meteor Shower is too busy setting up jokes to create the kind of fleshed out characters and relationships necessary to give the comedy real teeth, or to make us fear for the union under siege. Martin's structural gimmick involving time, and a Fight Club-style twist hinted at in Corky's earlier warning, seem more like improv-comedy fodder than grist for a full-length play.
showScoreExcerpt: Steve Martin's first new play in more than a decade proves to be a slight but likable comedy that gets by on the charm of its four-person cast and the playwright's gift for absurdist dialogue.

textIssues: Show title not found in text
wrongFullText:
The singer hit the American Music Awards red carpet on Sunday with a new blond hairdo. Gomez, who is performing her new single with Marshmello, “Wolves,” during the awards ceremony, paired her lighter locks with a rosy lip and a leather minidress by Coach.

Earlier in the week, Gomez unveiled on Instagram that she would be hitting the AMAs stage. “My first performance in over a year.. the AMAs have been a place where I’ve shared some of my most intimate moments. Heart wants what it wants, after treatment and now Wolves. This Sunday,” she captioned a video, in which she’s seen rehearsing her song.

The 25-year-old’s beauty transformation comes hours after she teased having bangs in her Instagram Story.

Though Gomez is rumored to have rekindled her relationship with Justin Bieber, she made a solo appearance on the red carpet.
